title: Calories in a Caesar Chicken Wrap
meta_description: Discover calories in caesar chicken wrap, including protein, carbs, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a Caesar Chicken Wrap
assumptions: Standard flour tortilla (10-inch), 100g grilled chicken breast, romaine lettuce, Caesar dressing (2 tbsp), parmesan cheese (1 tbsp), no croutons; total weight ~300g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, portion size, ingredients, and preparation method. Check labels or restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical Caesar chicken wrap contains ~550 kcal and ~30 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use low-fat Caesar dressing (1 tbsp instead of 2)
Whole wheat tortilla instead of flour

faqs.q: How many calories in a Caesar chicken wrap?
faqs.a: Approximately 550 kcal for a standard wrap with grilled chicken and dressing.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Caesar chicken wrap?
faqs.a: About 30 g protein, mainly from the chicken breast.

faqs.q: Are Caesar chicken wraps high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1200 mg due to dressing and cheese; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: How to make a lower-calorie Caesar chicken wrap?
faqs.a: Use low-fat dressing, skip cheese, or add more veggies to reduce calories by 100+.

faqs.q: Does the tortilla type affect calories in Caesar chicken wrap?
faqs.a: Flour tortilla adds ~200 kcal; switch to whole wheat or lettuce wrap to cut ~50-100 kcal.
